A day is a arbitrary time measure mainly because it was more convenient for scheduling things. The solar system wasn’t to our standards, so we built our own standard and changed it out.  For most ordinary local activities the old fashioned checking were the sun is system works just fine. It would have worked fine with the aliens too, at least for the purpose of a simple drop in. But for some reason we have decided that our modern time standard is the “right” one and we have to fit everything to that, forgetting that the old where we see the sun method is why what really governs our lives, and the lives most other living things in the world.

The length of a 'second' is gradually getting longer over the course of millennia. This is due to the fact that the Earths rotation is gradually slowing due to the interaction between the Sun, Earth, Moon, tides & atmosphere, all creating drag on the Earth, slowing down the Earths spin rate

A "day" is a made up measurement based on the amount of time it takes for the Earth to make one full rotation, regardless of it's position as it revolves around the Sun. Thanks to the degree the Earth's axis is tilted this leaves our measured "high noon" period occurring at roughly the same "time" every "day" regardless of where the Earth is positioned around the Sun. We've calculated it takes approximately 365 "days" for the Earth to revolve around the Sun once, giving us 365 "days" in one "year", which we've broken down into 52 "weeks" in one "year", and 7 "days" in one "week".
